appearances.title: Face the Nation : KPIX : January 5, 2026 2:00am-2:30am PST
appearances.snippet: senate intelligence chair tom cotton and the top democrat on the intelligence committee and chris van hollen will also be here. it's all ahead on face the nation. good morning and welcome to "face the nation." americas woke up yesterday to the shocking news that the u.s. had staged a massive air attack on the capital of venezuela and captured nicolas maduro. we will talk about what it means for the u.s. and why it's a seismic development. we start with marco rubio who joins us this morning from miami. good morning to you, mr. secretary. >> good morning. good morning. >> president trump said that the united states will run the country and that venezuela will be largely run by, he pointed to you and some of the other cabinet members when he spoke to the public yesterday. he said the u.s. retains all military options including boots on the ground until u.s. demands have been fully met. how do you plan to run the country? well, first of all, i think the important thing to point out that the key to what that regime lies on is the economy fueled by oil. right now it's an oil industry that is backw

appearances.title: Newsmakers Rep. Raul Grijalva : CSPAN : January 2, 2026 3:19am-3:33am EST
appearances.snippet: she was not able to prevail over chris van hollen in maryland. in pennsylvania we had a similar dynamic in a senate race. john fetterman, who was a sanders endorser, tried to align with bernie sanders, was not able to get through. what do you make of these races where progressives try to take on the establishment democrats that have not quite made it? are there any lessons from these races? do you think democrats are getting support from the party to make a difference? rep. grijalva: that ties into your question about the convention, about state parties, county parties, their political infrastructure, and the national parties. the fact that -- the coziness of how decisions are made kind of precludes the competitive races you need to have in order for this party to establish its identity. that's what's going on with the democratic party and may be politics as a whole, defining who we are as a nation politically. for our party, i think those races are healthy, necessary, and the fact that some prevailed and others didn't -- i don't think it was as

appearances.title: All In With Chris Hayes : MSNOW : January 7, 2026 5:00pm-6:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: senator chris van hollen is a democrat of maryland.t kilmer garcia, and he joins me now. senator, it's good to have you here. first, just your reaction to both what happened today and to the characterization that immediately flowed from top government officials from the department of homeland security secretary's spokesperson to the secretary, herself, to the president. >> right, chris. this is awful on so many levels. first, we have the unnecessary shooting death of a 37 year old mom, unjustified. and then we have the trump administration from the secretary of homeland security, kristi noem, to the president of united states lying about it, kristi noem, saying this was an act of domestic terrorism, calling this 37 year old mom essentially a terrorist. and this goes to the heart of the problem we're facing right now, which is an administration that just constantly lies to the american people, tries to gaslight all of us, tries to tell us that what we can see with our own eyes is not true. imagine if emily had not taken that video. we w

appearances.snippet: we'll talk to democratic senator chris van hollen, a member of the foreign relations committee, in just moments. and five years since the january 6th insurrection, the rioters are all pardoned, and the man they marched for is back in the white house. how democrats are trying to undercut efforts to rewrite what happened. good morning. it's 10:00 eastern, 7 a.m. pacific. i'm ana cabrera, reporting from new york. the u.s. will keep the oil. that is what the president told miss. now, about the plan ahead in venezuela, with questions piling up about next steps after capturing nicolas maduro, president trump has made oil the clear focal point of this nation building project, but already he has reversed a claim he made in the immediate aftermath of the u.s. takeover, saying oil companies would be the ones to spend billions repairing venezuela's infrastructure. trump is now saying the u.s. may reimburse those companies in moments. president trump will meet with house republicans, some of whom are itching to find out if there is a plan beyond more oil and more oil profits. let's discuss all of t

appearances.snippet: we are going to talk to senator chris van hollen who is here in person. >> good to be with you. >> weblems, we hope. let's pick up on that very same point we were discussing with congressman himes there. he says no information was being shared with the top people who have oversight, like himself. what leverage do democrats have to force the administration to treat congress as a coequal branch of government? >> well, margaret, it's hard when the republicans in congress are totally awol. when they want to give donald trump essentially a blank check because they continue to have the majorities, of course, in the house and senate. obviously in 2026, if democrats regain control of either house, we will have the gavel, but in the meantime, we need to go directly to the american people and just make it very clear that in this case, it's my view that the trump administration has been lying to the american people. this has never been about stopping drugs from coming to the united states. we all support stopping drugs. this from the beginning has been about getting rid of maduro, grabbing venez

appearances.title: CNN News Central : CNNW : January 5, 2026 5:00am-6:01am PST
appearances.snippet: with us now is maryland senator chris van hollen, a democrat on the foreign relations committee.senator, nice to see you this morning. who do you think is running venezuela? >> well, john, it's good to be with you. we really don't know who's running venezuela other than the fact that the vice president maduro's number two is currently in charge, as is the maduro secretary of defense and interior minister. so donald trump says we're running, venezuela. he wants to run venezuela, even though we have all these challenges here at home, and he wants to do it, john, for one purpose. and he said it again. he wants u.s. oil companies to be able to grab venezuelan oil. at the end of the day, that's what this is all about in donald trump's mind. i would just remind people that when he was talking about iraq, donald trump said, the big mistake we made was we didn't grab iraq's oil. and so he has put our troops, who performed magnificently. he's put their lives at risk so that more american oil companies can make >> and their buddies on wall street can benefit. >> of course, both democrats a

appearances.title: The Source With Kaitlan Collins : CNNW : January 6, 2026 6:00pm-7:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: maryland democrat senator chris van hollen. and thank you, senator, for being here. can i just first get your reaction to the president's announcement that is breaking tonight, where he's talking about basically, it sounds like venezuela giving the united states 30 to 50 million barrels of oil. and then he says that money after that oil is sold at market price would belong to him as the president of the united states, to the united states. do you believe that's legal? >> none of this operation has been legal. caitlin. and what the president did was reveal very clearly, as he's been doing for days, that this is all about grabbing venezuelans oil and maybe other natural resources for the benefit of american oil companies and his billionaire buddies. he's had his minions, secretary rubio and others try to pretend it's about something else. this has never been about stopping drugs from coming to the united states. it's never about trying to bring democracy to venezuela and getting rid of a dictator. so things will be better for the venezuelan people. it's been all about

appearances.snippet: i want to express my thanks to subcommittee chairman jerry moran and ranking member chris van hollenr their hard work on the cgs bill. next, the interior bill provides resources for the management and conservation of public lands while fostering the economic development throughout critical -- through critical energy programs. it supports tribal programs across the country, helps ensure that americans have clean air, water, and soil, and provides federal firefighters with the tools they need to prepare for and suppress wildfires. it also includes funding to fight the devastating impact of the spruce budworm, which is being experienced right now in the state of maine and other states. i want to commend the subcommittee chair, lisa murkowski, and the ranking member jeff merkley for their efforts in crafting this legislation. finally, the energy and water development bill will improve water infrastructure and promote american energy independence. it will also strengthen our nuclear deterrence posture, ensure that our nuclear stockpiles' readiness and safety, and prepare for existing and

appearances.snippet: senator chris van hollen, from the foreign relations committee, democrat from maryland, told msnbc justlast year, he said, the united states needs to work with its partners and allies in the region to ratchet up pressure on venezuela. democrats know absolutely that president trump did the absolute right thing. they won't admit it on this floor. they prefer to play politics instead. within the last several days, senator schumer called arresting maduro reckless. what a change and reversal in tune. senator van hollen said it was an illegal act of war. complete reversal of his previous positions. senator murphy told cnn on sunday, venezuela, he said, is not a security threat to the united states. sure viewed it differently in the past. evidently, they were all for it before they were against it. that's what we see with these democrats, something they're for, president trump does it now they're against it. the question for democrats is do they no longer think that arresting maduro was a good thing? they supported it in the past, every one of them. arresting maduro was not partisan or politic
